meanings.definition: A man who serves in the British army as an officer's personal servant.
meanings.sent1: The batmen in the army help the officers with their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The batmen are responsible for assisting the officers in their duties.
meanings.sent3: The batmen always make sure the officers' uniforms are neat and tidy.
meanings.sent4: The batmen are like shadows, silently supporting the officers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the batmen diligently serving the officers is ingrained in military history.

meanings.definition: A superhero character created by DC Comics, known for fighting crime in Gotham City.
meanings.sent1: The batmen swooped in to save the day and capture the villain.
meanings.sent2: People look up to the batmen for protecting the city from evil.
meanings.sent3: The batmen's cape billowed dramatically as they chased the criminal.
meanings.sent4: In the comic, the batmen symbolize justice and bravery.
meanings.sent5: The batmen's symbol shines brightly in the night sky, a beacon of hope for Gotham City.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'batman', referring to more than one man who serves as an officer's personal servant.
meanings.sent1: The group of batmen stood ready to assist the officers at any moment.
meanings.sent2: The batmen worked together seamlessly to support the officers.
meanings.sent3: It was a sight to see the batmen efficiently organizing the officer's belongings.
meanings.sent4: The batmen moved with precision, anticipating the officer's needs.
meanings.sent5: The unity among the batmen was evident in their synchronized actions.
